intro: Genista demnatensis var. valdespinulosa, commonly known as the Valdespinulosa Broom, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions of North Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its typical legume structure and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features slender, spiny stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and ecological role in stabilizing coastal and arid environments.
